title: Fix: Move deprecated APIs to deprecated.mbt across all packages
description:
Deprecated blocks live in primary files instead of deprecated.mbt across multiple packages:

- int/int.mbt:23, int/int.mbt:29
- int64/int64.mbt:21, int64/int64.mbt:36
- uint/uint.mbt:37
- uint16/uint16.mbt:22-25
- float/float.mbt, float/pow.mbt
- double/double.mbt
- immut/list/list.mbt
- and others

This breaks the repo refactoring guideline and makes the public surface harder to scan.

Expected Behavior: Move all deprecated functions into per-package deprecated.mbt files.

title: Fix: PriorityQueue debug output unstable
description:
PriorityQueue debug output is documented as 'sorted for stable output' but is emitted in heap order without sorting, which can be unstable across runs/targets.

Location: debug/debug.mbt:200 and debug/debug.mbt:259

Expected Behavior: Either sort elements before rendering, or remove the 'stable output' claim and document unstable order.

title: Fix: UTF-8 decode_lossy consumes partial bytes on malformed
description:
decode_lossy for UTF-8 replaces invalid multi-byte sequences but only consumes 2-3 bytes for those cases, which can desynchronize decoding and emit extra U+FFFDs.

Location: encoding/utf8/decode.mbt:222-247

Expected Behavior: Should consume either one byte or the full expected sequence length on malformed input, and encode that policy explicitly.

title: Fix: Endian byte conversion APIs inconsistent across integer types
description:
Endian byte conversion APIs are inconsistent:

- Int::to_be_bytes/Int::to_le_bytes - deprecated+hidden (int/int.mbt:29)
- UInt::to_be_bytes/UInt::to_le_bytes - deprecated+hidden (uint/uint.mbt:37)
- Int64::to_be_bytes/Int64::to_le_bytes - deprecated+hidden (int64/int64.mbt:36)
- UInt64::to_be_bytes/UInt64::to_le_bytes - public and documented (uint64/uint64.mbt:21)

This is a confusing public API split.

Expected Behavior: Normalize endian-byte APIs across all integer packages: either keep them all public or all deprecated+hidden.

title: Fix: Reverse compare negation overflow risk
description:
Reverse::compare negates the result of compare, which can overflow if a Compare impl returns Int::min (or any non-{-1,0,1} value).

Location: cmp/cmp.mbt:36-39

Safer reversal is b.0.compare(a.0) to avoid negation overflow.

Expected Behavior: Use b.0.compare(a.0) instead of negation.

title: Fix: env current_dir() has fixed 4096-byte buffer
description:
env.current_dir() in native uses a fixed 4096-byte buffer and returns None on failure without retry, which can fail for long paths.

Location: env/env_native.mbt:89-96

Expected Behavior: Should retry with a larger buffer on getcwd failure, or document the 4096-byte limit.

title: Fix: HashMap new minimum capacity docs mismatch
description:
HashMap::new docs promise a minimum capacity of 8, but the implementation only does capacity.next_power_of_two() so capacity=0 yields 1 (and 1 is allowed).

Location: hashmap/hashmap.mbt:15-45

This diverges from the documented guarantee and can surprise users who rely on the minimum size.

Expected Behavior: Either enforce minimum capacity of 8 in code, or update docs to match reality.

title: Fix: Regex Engine dense table indexing crash on non-zero lb
description:
Dense symbol table indexing ignores `lb`, so non-zero valid ranges can crash.

Location: `internal/regex_engine/symbol_map/symbol_map.mbt`, `internal/regex_engine/symbol_map/dense_table.mbt`

Root Cause: `SymbolMap::finalize_dense` writes `table[c]` with `table` sized `ub - lb + 1`, and `DenseTable::map` indexes `self.0[c]` directly. Any profile where `lb != 0` will index out of bounds.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a symbol map with non-zero lower bound (lb != 0)
2. Call finalize_dense on the map
3. Try to access via DenseTable::map

Expected Behavior: Should handle non-zero lb correctly or panic with clear error message.

title: Fix: BigInt to_uint incorrect for negative values
description:
BigInt::to_uint is incorrect for negative values less than -2^32 because it only adds 2^32 once, not modulo 2^32.

Location: bigint/bigint_nonjs.mbt:1722

Example: (-8589934593N).to_uint() should be 4294967295, but (1N << 32) + self yields -(2^32+1) and limbs[0] becomes 1.

Expected Behavior: Should return lower 32 bits modulo 2^32 for all negative values.

title: Fix: HashMap length is O(n) and to_array double-walks
description:
HashMap::length is O(n) and HashMap::to_array calls it for capacity, so to_array does two full traversals.

Location: immut/hashmap/HAMT.mbt:339 and 726

Expected Behavior: Should consider tracking size in HashMap to avoid double traversal, or provide a cheap to_array without prealloc.

title: Fix: Regex iter stack overflow on large quantifiers
description:
iter in translate is recursive; large {n,m} quantifiers can overflow the stack.

Location: internal/regex_engine/translate.mbt

Expected Behavior: Should use iteration instead of recursion for large quantifier bounds.

title: Fix: SortedMap range docs incorrect
description:
SortedMap::range docs say 'returns a new array', but the function returns an Iter2 and the inline comments invert the comparison semantics (key > low vs key < low).

Location: sorted_map/map.mbt:289-329

This can mislead callers and future maintainers.

Expected Behavior: Docs should accurately describe the return type (Iter2) and the comparison semantics.

title: Fix: env now() precision inconsistent across backends
description:
env.now() precision is backend-dependent: native uses time(0) (seconds) and multiplies by 1000 while JS uses Date.now() (millisecond precision).

Location: env/env_native.mbt:78-81, env/env_js.mbt:26-30

This makes now() resolution inconsistent across targets.

Expected Behavior: Should have consistent precision across backends, or document the discrepancy.

title: Fix: FromJson for BigInt aborts instead of raising error
description:
FromJson for BigInt calls BigInt::from_string without catching parse failures, so invalid input aborts instead of raising JsonDecodeError.

Location: bigint/bigint.mbt:49

This is user-visible error handling for JSON decode paths.

Expected Behavior: Should catch parse errors and raise JsonDecodeError.

title: Fix: Bitset remove toggles bit
description:
Bitset::remove toggles the bit with XOR, so calling remove on an absent index will add it (no precondition documented).

Location: immut/internal/sparse_array/bitset.mbt:56

Expected Behavior: Should clear the bit (with & ~) or document the XOR precondition clearly.

title: Fix: Deque drain accepts negative start/len
description:
Deque::drain accepts negative start/len, which can drive invalid slice math and UninitializedArray::make(len) with a negative size.

Location: deque/deque.mbt:1892-1904

start only checked >= self.len, len only clamped by <= max_len.

Examples that cause bugs: drain(start=-1, len=2) or drain(start=0, len=-1).

Expected Behavior: Should validate start >= 0 and len >= 0 and return empty or abort consistently.

title: Fix: SparseArray union/difference/filter crash on empty inputs
description:
SparseArray::union/difference/filter build a FixedArray with self.data[0] even when self is empty, which can crash on empty inputs.

Location: immut/internal/sparse_array/sparse_array.mbt:116, 180, 224

Example: @sparse_array.empty().union(@sparse_array.singleton(1, 1), ...)

Expected Behavior: Should handle empty inputs gracefully.

title: Fix: API naming inconsistencies across collection types
description:
API naming inconsistencies:

- SortedSet uses subset/disjoint while HashSet and Set expose is_subset/is_disjoint
- HashMap::union vs SortedMap::merge vs SortedSet::merge suggest similar operations but different names
- Float::is_close active while Double::is_close deprecated
- Float::to_be_bytes public while Double::to_be_bytes deprecated/hidden

Expected Behavior: Standardize naming for consistency across collection families.

title: Fix: render docs mention compact_threshold but parameter missing
description:
render docs mention a compact_threshold? parameter and default of 80, but the function has only max_depth? and uses default_threshold = 30.

Location: debug/pretty_print.mbt:19 and 298

Expected Behavior: Fix docs or add the missing compact_threshold parameter.

title: Fix: Option to_string inconsistent with Show
description:
Option::to_string builds Some( + x.to_string() + ), which yields raw strings for String (since String::to_string is unescaped) while the Show impl for X? escapes via write_object.

Location: builtin/option.mbt:25-29

This makes option.to_string() inconsistent with repr() / Show, especially for strings containing newlines or quotes.

Expected Behavior: Either deprecate Option::to_string in favor of Show/repr, or reimplement using Show::output to match escaped representation.

title: Fix: Regex Engine line boundary assertions only split on '\n'
description:
Line boundary assertions only split on '\n', so StartOfLine/EndOfLine can misbehave if profile.category treats other line terminators as newline.

Location: internal/regex_engine/symbolize.mbt

Root Cause: symbolize hardcodes RecharSet::char('\n') instead of using profile.line_terminator, which means categories may collapse in symbol_repr for \r, \u2028, etc.

Expected Behavior: Should split on profile.line_terminator, not just '\n'.

title: Fix: benchmark count=0 leads to failure
description:
count=0 in benchmarks leads to empty samples and percentile guard failure, since iter_count doesn't enforce a minimum count before calling winsorize.

Location: bench/bench.mbt:26 and bench/stats.mbt:161

Expected Behavior: Should enforce count >= 1 or raise a clear error.

title: Fix: size not validated as non-negative in Arbitrary
description:
size is not validated as non-negative, but it's used in modulo operations and as array/bytes lengths, which can break for negative inputs.

Location: quickcheck/arbitrary.mbt:35 and quickcheck/arbitrary.mbt:158

Expected Behavior: Should validate size >= 0 or document how negative sizes are handled.

title: Fix: BigInt from_int64 overflow on Int64::min
description:
BigInt::from_int64 overflows on Int64::min because it negates n before converting, which is undefined for the minimum two's-complement value.

Location: bigint/bigint_nonjs.mbt:146

Example: from_int64(-9223372036854775808L) negates n before reinterpret_as_uint64().

Expected Behavior: Should handle Int64::min correctly.

title: Fix: JSON string escape doesn't combine surrogate pairs
description:
JSON string escape handling does not combine surrogate pairs from \uXXXX\uYYYY, and it will happily emit isolated surrogate code units.

Location: json/lex_string.mbt:43-46

This is non-compliant for JSON strings representing non-BMP code points.

Expected Behavior: Should combine surrogate pairs or reject isolated surrogates.

title: Fix: String Arbitrary builds via repeated concatenation O(n^2)
description:
String Arbitrary builds via repeated concatenation, which is O(n^2) and will be noticeably slow for larger sizes.

Location: quickcheck/arbitrary.mbt:102

Expected Behavior: Should switch to StringBuilder or pre-allocate for O(n) behavior.

title: Fix: List unsafe_tail visible while other unsafe methods hidden
description:
Unsafe API visibility is inconsistent in list: List::unsafe_tail is public and documented (no #internal/#doc(hidden)), while unsafe_head/unsafe_last are hidden.

Location: list/list.mbt:430-463

This exposes a panic-prone API in docs unexpectedly.

Expected Behavior: Either make all unsafe methods consistently public or consistently hidden.

title: Fix: abort docs mismatch on non-native targets
description:
abort docs say the message is displayed, but the non-native implementation discards it.

Location: abort/abort.mbt:16-30

This can surprise users who rely on the message for diagnostics.

Expected Behavior: Either change docs to 'message may be ignored on non-native targets', or add a non-native print mechanism if available.

title: Fix: UTF-16 decode_lossy truncates after first malformed chunk
description:
decode_lossy stops at the first malformed chunk because the _ => builder.write_char(U_REP) branches do not continue, so the loop exits and truncates remaining bytes.

Location: encoding/utf16/decode.mbt:149 and encoding/utf16/decode.mbt:177

Root Cause: Missing continue statement in the default case branches.

Expected Behavior: Should continue decoding after malformed bytes, not stop.
close_reason: Issue was incorrect - function works correctly, only test needed fixing

title: Fix: Minor code issues and typos
description:
Minor issues:

- UInt has default() but Int/Int16/Int64/UInt64 do not
- uint16 Int64 test coverage missing (only tests Int::to_uint16)
- Tree::get_first/get_last comments are swapped (immut/array/tree.mbt:63)
- Compare example comment wrong (immut/array/array.mbt:423)
- SortedSet::rev_iter example lacks mbt check
- Tests live in non-test file in sorted_set while others keep tests in *_test.mbt
- Regex::execute uses lastIndex camelCase while rest of API uses snake_case
- Quantifier is pub(all) but external users can't construct it
- Random new type mismatch in deprecated API
- two_over_pi allocated per call in trig_reduce

Expected Behavior: Fix typos, add missing tests, align consistency.

title: Fix: JSON numeric overflow treated as Infinity
description:
JSON numeric overflow is treated as Infinity with a preserved string repr, which makes parse accept syntactically valid but non-finite numbers and later FromJson rejects them as 'expected number.'

Location: json/lex_number.mbt:152-178 (Infinity fallback), json/json.mbt:297-310 (stringify uses repr), json/from_json.mbt:50-110 (Infinity rejected)

This can break round-trips like parse -> from_json for large integers or exponents.

Expected Behavior: Either return ParseError for numbers that cannot be represented as finite Double, or formalize the Infinity + repr approach in docs.

title: Fix: README and documentation accuracy issues
description:
Multiple README and documentation issues:

- byte/README.md claims @byte.to_uint64 but package exports no such function
- bool/README.md says package provides utility functions but pkg.generated.mbti shows empty exports
- immut/priority_queue/README.mbt.md claims pairing heap but is binary heap, recommends deprecated of()
- immut/internal/path/README.mbt.md comment says Single level path while is_last is false

Expected Behavior: Align README claims with actual exports and implementation.

title: Fix: Pattern is_anchored incorrect for sequences
description:
Pattern::is_anchored treats any anchored node in a Sequence as anchoring the whole sequence. This can incorrectly skip the implicit .*? prefix for patterns where ^ is not first.

Location: internal/regex_engine/ast/pattern.mbt

Expected Behavior: Should only treat sequences as anchored if anchored at start.

title: Fix: Index bounds not guarded for Bitset/SparseArray/Path
description:
Index bounds are implicit for bitset/sparse array paths (idx expected 0..31). No guard or doc; out-of-range shifts are undefined/incorrect.

Location: immut/internal/sparse_array/bitset.mbt:23 and immut/internal/sparse_array/sparse_array.mbt:65

Expected Behavior: Document valid index range (0..31) and consider runtime guards in internal helpers.

title: Fix: Missing docstrings and inconsistent doc coverage
description:
Missing or inconsistent doc coverage:

- Hash docs say hash does not need to be consistent with hash_combine
- HashMap::at/SortedMap::at panic not documented
- Int16::abs behavior at min_value not documented (wraps)
- int64/uint/uint64 constants don't explain their ranges
- Ref::update missing docstring
- encoding/utf8/decode and decode_lossy essentially undocumented
- RecharSet public API has no docstrings at all
- Float is_close docs say returns false if infinite but returns true for +∞ vs +∞

Expected Behavior: Add docstrings for public APIs and fix documentation inconsistencies.
